NAME: HR
DESCRIPTION: Mine a Block on your Chain using HashRate.
INFO: The amount of computing power being consumed by the network to continuously operate. Secures the network.

DESCRIPTION: Target looses a Block.
INFO: If more than half the computer power on a network is run by a single entity, then a 51% attack is in operation

NAME: AGREE.
DESCRIPTION: Protects your Blocks once.
INFO: Consensus is achieved when all participants of the network agree on the order and content of blocks and transactions contained in those blocks.

NAME: ATH
DESCRIPTION: Random: all players get +1/0 HR.
INFO: All Time High: The highest point (in price, in market capitalization) that a cryptocurrency has been in history.

NAME: ATL
DESCRIPTION: Random: all players get 0/-1 HR.
INFO: All Time Low: The lowest point (in price, in market capitalization) that a cryptocurrency has been in history.

NAME: BEAR
DESCRIPTION: Target looses 1 HR.
INFO: Bear: A person who is pessimistic about market prices and expects them to decline. This person is also known to be 'bearish' about the market or price.

NAME: BOT
DESCRIPTION: Random: your 1 HR versus an opponent's 1 HR.
INFO: Trading Bot: Automated trading software bots that execute trade orders extremely quickly, based on a preset algorithm of buy-and-sell rules.

NAME: BTFD
DESCRIPTION: Get 1 HR. Others are challenged to get +1/0 HR.
INFO: Buy The F* Dip: An enthusiastic exclamation by supporters of a cryptocurrency to buy while prices are at a low point.

NAME: BULL
DESCRIPTION: You gain 2 HR.
INFO: Bull: A person that is optimistic and confident that market prices will increase, this person is also known to be 'bullish' about the market or price.

NAME: BYZ.
DESCRIPTION: All players must agree to all get 1 B -or- 1 HR.
INFO: Byzantine Generals’ Problem: A situation where communication that requires consensus on a single strategy from all members within a group or party cannot be trusted or verified.

NAME: CEX
DESCRIPTION: Swap 1 HR for 1 B.
INFO: Centralized Exchange: A centralized organizational structure is one in which a single node or a small number of them are in control of an entire network.

NAME: DCA
DESCRIPTION: Swap 1 B for 2 HR.
INFO: Dollar Cost Average: An investment strategy in which an investor divides up the total amount to be invested across periodic purchases of a target asset.

NAME: DEX
DESCRIPTION: Target must trade you 2 HR for any card (you want) from your Hand.
INFO: Decentralized Exchange: A peer-to-peer exchange that allows users to buy and sell cryptocurrency and other assets without a central intermediary involved.

NAME: DIFF--
DESCRIPTION: Your next Block requires 1 less HR to mine.
INFO: Difficulty Descrease: A relative measure of how difficult it is to discover a new block. Adjusts periodically proportionally to the hashing power of the network of miners.

NAME: DIFF++
DESCRIPTION: Target's next Block requires 1 more HR to mine.
INFO: Difficulty Increase: A relative measure of how difficult it is to discover a new block. Adjusts periodically as a function of how much hashing power has been deployed by the network of miners.

NAME: DOUBLE
DESCRIPTION: Play a (paid) Action card for free.
INFO: Double Spending: A situation where a sum of money is (illegitimately) spent more than once.

NAME: FEES
DESCRIPTION: Your next block rewards 1 more B.
INFO: Block Reward: By contributing to the security and liveness of the chain, the miner is rewarded with this incentive, ensuring that miners continue to act in the best interest of the blockchain.

NAME: FIAT
DESCRIPTION: Useless.
INFO: Fiat currency is 'legal tender' backed by a central government, such as the Federal Reserve, and with its own banking system, such as fractional reserve banking.

NAME: FLIP
DESCRIPTION: Swap Hand with an opponent.
INFO: The Flippening is the transition of other cryptocurrencies (such as Ethereum) growing bigger, more important, and more valuable than the #1 (Bitcoin).

NAME: FORK
DESCRIPTION: Steal the target's latest Block.
INFO: Forks, or chain splits, create an alternate version of the blockchain, leaving two blockchains to run simultaneously.

NAME: HALF
DESCRIPTION: Target's next block rewards 1 less B.
INFO: Halving: An event in which the total rewarded coins per confirmed block halves. Enforces scarcity.

NAME: HODL
DESCRIPTION: Protects 1 B -or- all your HR once.
INFO: Hodl: A type of passive investment strategy where you hold an investment regardless of any changes in the price or markets. The term first became famous due to a typo.

NAME: ICO
DESCRIPTION: Random: your 1 HR versus an opponent's 2 HR.
INFO: Initial Coin Offering: A type of crowdfunding, or crowdsale, using cryptocurrencies as a means of raising capital for early-stage companies.

NAME: KYC
DESCRIPTION: Prove your (IRL) identity -or- skip this turn.
INFO: Know Your Customer: This process refers to a centralized financial institution’s obligations to verify the identity of a customer in line with global anti-money laundering laws.

NAME: MARGIN
DESCRIPTION: Target looses 1 B.
INFO: Margin Called: When an investor’s account value falls below the margin maintenance amount. The broker will then demand that the investor deposit additional money to continue trading.

NAME: MINER
DESCRIPTION: Target must trade you all its HR for 1 B.
INFO: Mining: A process where blocks are added to a blockchain, verifying transactions. It is also the process through which new coins are created.

NAME: NO-COIN
DESCRIPTION: Player(s) with the least Coins get 1 B.
INFO: A no-coiner is someone who has no cryptocurrency in his or her investment portfolio and firmly believes that cryptocurrency in general will fail.

NAME: NONCE
DESCRIPTION: Mine a Block (for free) using the Pool.
INFO: When a transaction is hashed by a miner, an arbitrary number meant to be used only once is generated, called a nonce.

NAME: OFFLINE
DESCRIPTION: Protects any amount of HR once.
INFO: Cold Storage: The act of storing cryptocurrencies in devices or systems not connected to the internet.

NAME: ORACLE
DESCRIPTION: Target must reveal its Hand to you.
INFO: Oracle: An agent that finds and verifies information, bridging the real world and the blockchain by providing data to smart contracts.

NAME: P&D
DESCRIPTION: Random: you get +1/-1 HR., others get the opposite.
INFO: Pump&Dump: A form of securities fraud involving the artificial inflation of the price of a cryptocurrency with false and misleading positive statements in order to sell at a higher price.

NAME: PoS
DESCRIPTION: Any player holding 1+ HR gets 1 HR.
INFO: Proof-of-Stake: A blockchain consensus mechanism involving choosing the creator of the next block via various combinations of random selection and wealth or age of staked coins or tokens.

NAME: PONZI
DESCRIPTION: Random: each opponent must give you 1 B/HR, winner chooses.
INFO: Ponzi Scheme: A fraudulent investment involving the payment of purported returns to existing investors from funds contributed by new investors.

NAME: REKT
DESCRIPTION: Target must drop all HR in Hand.
INFO: A shorthand slang for 'wrecked', describing a bad loss in a trade.

NAME: SAT
DESCRIPTION: Gain 1 B.
INFO: Satoshi Nakamoto: The individual or group of individuals that created Bitcoin. The identity of Satoshi Nakamoto has never been confirmed.

NAME: SCAM
DESCRIPTION: Steal 2 HR from the target.
INFO: Scam: A fraudulent or deceptive cryptocurrency or ICO.

NAME: STABLE
DESCRIPTION: Swap 1 FIAT (in Hand or from Pool) for 2 HR.
INFO: Stablecoin: A cryptocurrency with extremely low volatility, sometimes used as a means of portfolio diversification. Examples include gold-backed cryptocurrency or fiat-pegged cryptocurrency.

NAME: STRONG
DESCRIPTION: Win any random challenge once.
INFO: Strong hands is a colloquial term that can refer to well-financed speculators or futures traders who wish to take delivery of the underlying asset.

NAME: SYBIL
DESCRIPTION: All players (including you) loose a Block.
INFO: In a Sybil attack, the attacker subverts the reputation system of a network service by creating a large number of fake identities to gain a disproportionately large influence.

NAME: T-L
DESCRIPTION: Target cannot play cards (nor mine) the turn following its next Block.
INFO: A Timelock is a type of smart contract primitive that restricts the spending of coins until a specified future time or block height.

NAME: TEST
DESCRIPTION: Cancels the last card (that cannot be played again this turn).
INFO: TestNet: An alternative blockchain used by developers for testing.

NAME: WEAK
DESCRIPTION: Loose any random challenge once.
INFO: Weak hands is the term often used to describe traders and investors who lack conviction in their strategies or lack the resources to carry them out.

NAME: WHALE
DESCRIPTION: You gain 2 HR -or- others loose 1 HR.
INFO: Whale: A term used to describe investors who have uncommonly large amounts of crypto, especially those with enough funds to manipulate the market.
